title: How to Clean out and Tidy a Cupboard

steps.headline: Identify the cupboard which you want to clean: make sure that the room is tidy as the items could get mixed up.
Get some storage containers: these could be bins or cardboard boxes or shoe boxes.
steps.description: They don't have to be too pretty because if they are hidden in a cupboard they don't have to be looked at every day.

steps.headline: Find a good marker pen: a permanent one would be best.
steps.description: Make sure that the colour is visible on the container. Black would be the best to use.

steps.headline: Remove everything from the cupboard: this prepares the cupboard for cleaning.
Make some hot soapy water: do this by adding washing up liquid into a bucket or bowl and pour in lukewarm to hot water.
Wipe all of the surfaces in the cupboard: if the floor is carpeted, use a vacuum cleaner.
Dry the surfaces: do this with a micro fibre cloth.
On the floor arrange the items: sort into 4 sections ( shown below)
Memorabilia and Decorations : These are things which are normally boxed such as photographs, old school book and memory items, holiday decorations(Christmas, Halloween),greetings cards etc.
steps.description: Sort all of these together and put to the back of the cupboard. It is best if they go here because there are other things that you need to have more accessible over things that you probably only use and want once or a few times a year. Remember to label to containers.

steps.headline: Things you use daily, weekly or monthly: This differs from person to person but it is usually things like cleaning products, a vacuum cleaner, clothing etc.
steps.description: it is important that you should put this at the front of the cupboard as it makes it more accessible and easy to obtain.

steps.headline: Unwanted- disposable : Are you an obsessive hoarder that keeps things just for the sake of it?
steps.description: Well if you are this step applies to you. To determine whether to throw something away ask yourself- does it hold any memories? If yes, add to one of the memorabilia. If no, ask yourself is the item old and broken or doesn't work well? If so, throw it away.

steps.headline: Unwanted- useful: This section is for items which are still of good quality, but you don't want any more.
steps.description: There are many ways which you can get rid of these items such as charity shops, eBay, car boot sales or placing an ad in a local newspaper.

steps.headline: Close the cupboard and be proud of your hard work and now tidy storage cupboard.
